page.title: 11FARMING IN LAYER BRETON
page.content:
The main farm to the east of the village is Nevards Farm which occupies 125 acres of agricultural land leased to a local farmer. The land, being well drained soil over London clay, is ideal for high yield cerea production. Due to modern farming methods only two or three people are employed to work this large acreage.
The landscape is fairly open and slopes considerably from a height of 45 metres to 19 metres, the level of Abberton Reservoir. Well maintained hedgerows allow wildlife to flourish and footpaths throughout the area provide pleasant walks. The presence of electricity pylons crossing the area is a feature of our modern times.
